publication.title: Gripping Parts at Concave Vertices
publication.jconf: International Conference on Robotics and Automation

publication.title: D-space and Deform Closure: a Framework for Holding Deformable Parts
publication.jconf: International Conference on Robotics and Automation
publication.keyword: Finite Element Mesh;Finite Element Method;Indexing Terms;Topology Preservation;
publication.abstract: We extend the form closure framework for rigid parts to holding a class of deformable parts. In this class, a part is a linearly elastic, frictionless polygon with a finite element mesh and given stiffness matrix. We define the D-space (deformation-space) of a part as the C-space of all its mesh nodes. We define the free space as the intersection

publication.title: D-space and Deform Closure Grasps of Deformable Parts
publication.keyword: Finite Element Mesh;Finite Element Method;Indexing Terms;Numerical Algorithm;Plastic Deformation;Potential Energy;Topology Preservation;
publication.abstract: Abstract â€“ Building on the well-established form closure framework for holding rigid parts, this paper proposes a new,framework for holding deformable parts. We consider the class of deformable parts that can bemodeled,as linearly elastic polygons with a triangular finite element mesh and given stiffness matrix. We define the D-space (deformation-space) of a ,part as the ,C-space of all its mesh
